speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: SCENE V. Lord Derby's house.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Enter DERBY and SIR CHRISTOPHER URSWICK

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: Sir Christopher, tell Richmond this from me:

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: That in the sty of this most bloody boar

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: My son George Stanley is frank'd up in hold:

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: If I revolt, off goes young George's head;

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: The fear of that withholds my present aid.

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: But, tell me, where is princely Richmond now?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
text_entry: At Pembroke, or at Harford-west, in Wales.

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: What men of name resort to him?

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
text_entry: Sir Walter Herbert, a renowned soldier;

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
text_entry: Sir Gilbert Talbot, Sir William Stanley;

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
text_entry: Oxford, redoubted Pembroke, Sir James Blunt,

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
text_entry: And Rice ap Thomas with a valiant crew;

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
text_entry: And many more of noble fame and worth:

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
text_entry: And towards London they do bend their course,

speaker: CHRISTOPHER
text_entry: If by the way they be not fought withal.

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: Return unto thy lord; commend me to him:

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: Tell him the queen hath heartily consented

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: He shall espouse Elizabeth her daughter.

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: These letters will resolve him of my mind. Farewell.

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: Exeunt
